title: IgnoredClassRunner should implement Filterable
body: `IgnoredClassRunner` should implement `Filterable`. Currently, if you have a test that uses `@RunWith(JUnit.class)` and you annotate the class with `@Ignore`, the class is no longer filterable. This leads to ugly special-case code.

title: Timeout exceptions should have stack trace from stuck thread
body:
It would be very helpful if tests with timeouts (I tend to use `@Test(timeout = ...)`) failed with exceptions that had a stack trace from the thread that was stuck or slow.

If a reference to the executing thread is saved (storing this information somewhere could be the first thing it does), then `Thread.getStackTrace()` will be available for inspection. The exception itself, however, would need to be special, because exceptions don't normally work with a *saved* array of stack frames, but instead appears to call into native code to generate the stack frame array every time it is needed.

title: Make Enclosed runner not try to run the tests in static nested classes without test methods
Resource leak in BaseTestRunner.java
body:
Resource leak in src/main/java/junit/runner/BaseTestRunner.java

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1916601/1063401/4364f946-12b2-11e3-97a4-46d8678b5c7f.png)

Note that you close "is" when an IOException is thrown, but not in the successful case.  You might want to change that catch block to a finally block.

title: Always close stream in readPreferences(). Fixes #729.
Added SystemProperty Rule
body: From time to time I have found myself setting and resetting System properties on @BeforeClass and @AfterClass. This new rule should make that a lot easier

title: Context Hierarchies for JUnit
body:
Anyone familiar with Ruby Specs knows, that using a context to structure your unit tests helps to keep your tests clean and readable, while it also reduces the number of boilerplate setup code tremendously.

A context runner may help to well structure and group JUnit tests that depend on the same preconditions while separating others that don't. An example can be found here: https://github.com/bechte/junit/wiki/JUnit-Context-Hierarchies

I will create a pull-request for this issue with a reference implementation within the experimental package of JUnit. This issue is for feedback and discussion, and to track the code changes.

title: #732 Implementation of a hierarchical context runner for JUnit
body:
As described in #732, here is an implementation of the hierarchical context runner for JUnit allowing to structure and group tests in context hierarchies such as the context known from rspec.

An code example on how to use contexts can be found here: http://www.bechte.de/2013/09/09/cleanup-your-junit-tests-by-using-contexts/

title: Change "Junit" to "JUnit" in website header
body: It's written JUnit everywhere else, looks like "Junit" was a typo.

title: Change signature of MultipleFailureException.assertEmpty() to throw Exception
body:
The current signature of AnnotationFormatError() makes it hard to use correctly. If you call it, you have
to declare that you throw Throwable, even though 1) unless someone explicitly throws Throwable or
a creates a subclass of Throwable, the method throws an Error or an Exception, and 2) even if the
method did throw Throwable, there's no reason to declare it.

title: Change FilterFactory code to pass in the actual Description
body: I still need to write more tests, but I wanted to send this out for an early look.

title: Support for non-public @Parameter
body:
Hello JUnit! 

This patch makes it possible to have @Parameter fields in @RunWith(Parameterized.class) tests non-public.

I'm not sure if my change to ParameterizedTestTest is really an appropriate and sufficient test for this minor extension. (But the patch does work and achieve what it should, of course.)

BTW: As I've also found that @Parameter was not yet documented on https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Parameterized-tests, I've taken the liberty of going ahead and directly adding a section about it (incl. ref. to this) - hope that's OK.

Regards,
Michael

title: Add an option to ignore timeouts
body:
When debugging JUnit tests, they often fails with timeout exception, when timeouts are set for individual methods via @Test(timeout=...) annotations. It would be valuable, when debugger could set an option to ignore all test timeouts.
See e.g.: https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=161568

title: #732 HierarchicalContextRunner: Bugfixes and Extension Points
body:
Modifications on the BlockJUnit4ClassRunner and the ParentRunner to allow easily extending the JUnit core without code duplication within the experimental HierarchicalContextRunner.

After I broke down all modifications, I was surprised that there are so few changes to avoid code duplication. Those changes in the BlockJUnit4ClassRunner seem more or less bugfixes to me. The annotated methods should always be obtained from the target object, otherwise the invocation will fail badly.

The modification within the ParentRunner allows to explicitly override the generation of class rules statement, which is sufficient as an extension point.

The modification within the TestClass are more or less a bit of a convenient thing, but I don't like getter-chains that much, therefore, I decided to introduce this delegator.

title: Hierarchical grouping of methods and classes as files and folders
body: I have noticed that when I equip my class, full of @Test methods, with @runwith.Suite annotation, the test methods go to ignore. I have created a question to ask for workarounds, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18894951 but I think that it is a wrong design.

title: Printing of StackTrace to console when using CDI
#727 Fail on timeout displays stack of stuck thread
body: New class: ExceptionWithThread.java (subclass of Exception that keeps information about some other relevant thread).  Changed: FailOnTimeout.java (starts test in a new ThreadGroup; on timeout, looks at running threads in ThreadGroup to see which one it thinks got stuck, creates an ExceptionWithThread if it finds one); Failure.java (displays stack for the "relevant thread" if it handles an ExceptionWithThread)

title: Indent with spaces (not tabs).
Extended Description with additional factory methods
body:
... to allow clients to specify alternative names for the Suites and Tests, without loosing the tied linking between the test result and the class / methods that specifies the test.

I added two (IMHO missing) factory methods, regrouped Suite and Test factories together and corrected the JavaDoc for all factory methods.

Note: I'd like to use these new factory methods having inner classes still link to their code while their names can differ from EnclosingClass$InnerClassName$AnotherInnerClass, e.g. AnotherInnerClass in this case. When the inner classes are well placed as children of their enclosing class, it makes sence to skip the enclosing class names in the description.

title: Minimise object creation without a failure.
body: For integer types in particular, creating two Long objects every time is expensive.  Doing a long == long is much cheaper and doesn't create garbage unless there is a failure.

title: Assert.fail() should have a return type of AssertionError, not void.
#746: return AssertionError from Assert#fail
body:
-return AssertionError from Assert.fail() and Assert.fail(String message)
to allow usage similar to Throwables#propagate from the Guava library.

title: Depending tests
body:
I want create One test which should be run at begining. Then should run or not other dependent test.

Real example.
Want create test which starts spring context. When its green than it run all tests which try crerate spring context. If this test will fail. Than rest of test shouldn't be invoked.


Currntly when you have multiple tests with spring. All test try to create spring in each test. And it take ages.

I dont wont to use some configuration in maven/gradle plugins.


THIS feature request is NOT for creating tests which use same data. Each test should be independent.

title: Allow expectation as parameter of custom message.
body: Simplifies the code, because custom and default message use the same code.

title: Parameterized runner hides Category annotation
Proposed fix for #380: @BeforeClass and @AfterClass methods are still run even if no tests will be run.
body:
Here's my proposed fix for #380. 
In order to execute @BeforeClass and @AfterClass methods as well as @ClassRules only if there are any tests remaining, I retrieve the list of filtered children before anything else is done, and filter ignored methods. For convenience I added FrameworkMethod.isIgnored() - in case this kind of self-awareness is unwanted this can be changed easily.
If there are no tests to be run remaining, a special case object statement is returned to maintain the signatures of the protected methods.

There's one specific change in behavior I'm not sure about: Previously the execution of getFilteredChildren() in runChildren(...) was nested inside a try-finally that notified the scheduler in the finally-block. This is no longer the case since the children are passed to that method as an input parameter. I don't know if this could cause bad side-effects.

Any comments and remarks would be appreciated. It's the first time I got in touch with the JUnit source and there's still a lot to learn. 
Thanks!

title: Extract annotations validation to a single class.
body: Encapsulate the algorithm about verifying annotations. SRP and it now reusable by people who build their own runners without extending ParrentRunner.

title: added ReleaseNotes for 4.5
body: Added in ReleaesNotes for 4.5 for https://github.com/junit-team/junit/issues/71

title: Made IgnoredClassRunner implement Filterable
body: Fix for issue https://github.com/junit-team/junit/issues/726
